data.message: I would really like the newsfeed to actually be sorted as most recent. I don't understand why some posts are visible immediately, while others take a day to show up. I also don't like that posts will cycle back to the top if someone comments or likes. This change to the newsfeed on mobile devices is very frustrating.

replies.message: Heather...those of us using the website have had to deal with that for over a year. Facebook isn't changing it anytime soon.

You can get it in order. On the left where it says news feed, there should be a dark grey arrow, click it and it will have an option for top stories or most recent. After doing this a couple times, FB does it automatically. Hope this helps!!
I appreciate the attempt, but no arrow on the iOS app that I have seen. Just quite annoying. Oh well.
In iOS , You should see a little gear symbol next to newsfeed in your left column list and that allow you to choose most recent or top stories
I have to change mine all the time, it resets itself back to top stories all the time.
// I think u were on your phone. That's why u don't see it until later the phone isn't recent like computer
